get.summary: List/Search all entities stored at intacct
get.description: Entity is a type of location (a dimension) that is available in multi-entity shared companies only. An entity can represent a business unit, company, division, legal entity, offices, and so forth.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Page size or up to number of elements to returning

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Current page requested

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Keyword to search if some key has match

get.description: Location is a dimension that can be defined by the company and set on transactions to expand report functionality and insight.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Page size or up to number of elements to returning

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Current page requested

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Keyword to search if some key has match

get.summary: List/Search all locations given an entity id
get.description: Location is a dimension that can be defined by the company and set on transactions to expand report functionality and insight.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Page size or up to number of elements to returning

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Current page requested

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Keyword to search if some key has match

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: This id is the parentId required to list locations that belongs to an entity, check endpoint GET /entities

post.description:
Create a property require to associate with existing collections such as entities and locations.
1. Fill **entity** object using *GET /entities* endpoint. 
1. Fill **location** object using *GET /locations* endpoint.

post.summary: Create unit associated to a property uuid
post.description:
Create a unit require to associate with existing collections such as properties and locations.
1. Fill the param *POST* units/property/**propertyUUID** using *GET /properties* endpoint to get that collections and select a valid uuid. 
1. Fill **location** object using *GET /locations* endpoint.

parameters.name: propertyUUID
parameters.description: Unique UUID string key use to identify items.
